components.html:
Get verification codes with an Authenticator App

If you set up 2-Step Verification, you can use an Authenticator App to receive codes. You can still receive codes without an internet connection or mobile service.

For example, Google Authenticator, Microsoft Authenticator, Authy, etc.
components.label: Content

actions.name: Set Values
Set Content
actions.content:
Please write it down in a safe place..
If you lose access to your two-factor authentication credentials, you can use these recovery codes to log in.
Each code is acceptable to one time login. After login it will be deleted.
{{data.recoveryCodes}}

result = code && code.replace(/_/g, '').length === 6;

On Premise
components.custom:
var preset = {
  plan: 'enterprise',
  projects: null,
  tenants: 0,
  stages: 10,
  emails: null,
  forms: null,
  formRequests: null,
  formManagers: 0,
  submissionRequests: null,
  pdfs: null,
  pdfDownloads: null,
  pdfServers: 3,
  apiServers: 3,
}

try {
  var instances = form.flattenComponents()

  _.each(preset, function(value, key) {
    if (!instances[key]) {
      throw new Error('Invalid key: ' + key)
    }

    if (value === null) {
      instances[key].dataValue = null
      instances[key].setValueAt(0, null)
      instances[key].resetValue()
    }

    instances[key].setValue(value)
  })
  
  instances.scope.setValue([
      'apiServer',
      'pdfServer',
      'project',
      'tenant',
      'stage',
      'form',
      'formRequest',
      'formManager',
      'email',
      'pdf',
      'pdfDownload',
      'submissionRequest',
    ])
}
catch (e) {
  debugger
  alert('Error applying preset: ' + e.toString())
}
